Job.Question: 625BR
Sr Engineer
Homestead
PA
Engineering
Job.JobDescription: Position has responsibility for coordination of all technical activities on assigned projects. Plans, schedules, conducts, and coordinates assigned engineering work; monitors work for compliance to applicable codes, accepted engineering practices, and Eichleay standards; ensures effective communication and coordination on assigned projects between all disciplines and all other project participants. Responsible and accountable to ensure that all assigned personnel are coordinating their activities with other project participants, and that the requirements of the Contract are being satisfied. Not responsible to ensure the technical accuracy of specific design details in areas where not qualified. Expected however, to have sufficient technical knowledge and awareness of details to be able to recognize when technical problems are developing in the various disciplines, and to initiate appropriate corrective actions. While on a project, the Project Engineer reports to the Project Manager, who has ultimate responsibility for both the quality of Eichleay’s deliverable and effective execution of project assignments. On projects where no Project Engineer is assigned, Project Manager is responsible for these duties. On a large project the Project Manager may delegate certain project management responsibilities to the Project Engineer, including day-to-day interaction with the Client’s designated representative as well as coordination of all internal activities performed by Eichleay’s staff. However, the designated Project Manager retains overall accountability for relationship management and Client satisfaction on the project. Typical Duties: Typical duties will include but not be limited to the preparation of the following: • Project engineering schedules and forecasts. • Coordination and checking of engineering deliverables. • Monthly project status reports and change orders. Essential Functions: Responsibilities will include but not be limited to the following: • Responsible for planning, scheduling, conducting and coordinating the technical and management aspects of projects. • Accountable for the successful completion of engineering projects. • Requires extensive regular contact with assigned project Clients. • Assist in the preparation of engineering project proposals. • Budget monitoring and trend tracking. • Participating in Client/contractor meetings and resolving Client/engineering and management project issues. 1 PROJECT ENGINEER • Review and approve project Client invoices. • Ensure effective engineering and Client communications. Education/Experience: • Bachelor of Science degree in engineering, and over ten years of experience with advance knowledge, obtainable usually through a combination of experience and continuing education; or • Equivalent combination of education, training and experience. Skills and Special Requirements/Licensing: • AutoCAD highly desirable. • BATC Safety Training • Experience in working with multiple discipline projects. • Excellent computer skills in Microsoft Suite. • Licensed engineer is preferred. • Pre-employment drug and alcohol screening. • Background screening includes previous employment, education, criminal history, and driving record verification.

Job.Question: 627BR
Sr. Recuriter
Philadelphia
PA
Engineering
Financial
Job.JobDescription:
Responsible for delivering superior Engineering design services for assigned client accounts. Maintain high customer satisfaction and develop valued Aerospace and Industrial Equipment (AIE) and client partnerships. Maximize AIE delivery solution for every assigned client account achieving established goals and targets. Work in partnership with AIE Business Development and Operations to develop and execute business expansion plans. Responsible for project execution, scope definition, customer engagement, contract management, and resource management. Assist in

growing revenue in targeted business territories in AIE. Partners with the Business Development Teams to develop, create, and promote customized Engineering and/or Manufacturing support solutions for clients. Leads delivery teams to help clients meet their short and long-term expectations, while meeting CDI’s strategic business goals.



ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

  • Develop and maintain a deep knowledge of assigned clients: strengths,environment, culture, needs, challenges, opportunities, supplier strategies and CDI’s contract(s). Works with the entire AIE team in using this knowledge to improve current and expanded Engineering services for the client.
  • Engages directly with key clients to solidify, grow and expand CDI business opportunities.
  • Develops and executes delivery strategies to optimize delivery performance to meet service/contractual obligations.
  • Develops and executes plans to meet annual budget expectations
  • Partners with various supporting organizations (IT, Finance, HR etc.), as appropriate, to ensure the effective implementation and execution of an appropriate engagement methodology and approach that ensures client satisfaction.
  • Develops and grows customer relationships with key decision makers.
  • Exhibits collaborative efforts with the Business Development Organization

Job.Question: 629BR
Cashier
Apex
NC
Job.JobDescription:
Cashiers provide the fastest and most pleasant customer service by actively communicating with every customer including greeting, thanking by name and any other courtesy guideline. Cashiers accurately scan customers' orders, and handle monies and tender to insure proper accounting of customer transactions. In addition, Cashiers properly bag customers’ orders, work well with co-workers and supervisors, maintain cash control and ringing procedures to eliminate shrink, and maintain a clean work area. As needed, a Cashier directs customers to his/her lane, and performs other duties as assigned by management.

QUALIFICATIONS:
  • Friendly, outgoing personality
  • Ability to work well with others
  • Ability to lift a minimum of 25 lbs. occasionally and 15 lbs. constantly
  • Ability to read and understand information and direction
  • Demonstrate successful use of math skills
  • Ability to stand for extended periods of time
  • Effective communication and customer service skills
  • Ability to retrieve and push in shopping carts
  • Ability to bend and lift to load customer orders into cars

Job.Question: 631BR
Manager
Job.JobDescription: Summary/Objective The human resource manager is directly responsible for the overall administration, coordination and evaluation of the human resource function. Essential Functions Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. 1. Develops and administers various human resources plans and procedures for all company personnel. 2. Plans, organizes and controls all activities of the department. Participates in developing department goals, objectives and systems. 3. Implements and annually updates compensation program; rewrites job descriptions as necessary; conducts annual salary surveys and develops merit pool (salary budget); analyzes compensation; monitors the performance evaluation program and revises as necessary. 4. Develops, recommends and implements personnel policies and procedures; prepares and maintains handbook on policies and procedures; performs benefits administration to include claims resolution, change reporting, approving invoices for payment, annual re-evaluation of policies for cost-effectiveness, information activities program and cash flow. 5. Develops and maintains affirmative action program; files EEO-1 annually; maintains other records, reports and logs to conform to EEO regulations. 6. Conducts recruitment effort for all exempt and nonexempt personnel, students and temporary employees; conducts new-employee orientations; monitors career-pathing program, employee relations counseling, outplacement counseling and exit interviewing; writes and places advertisements. 7. Establishes and maintains department records and reports. Participates in administrative staff meetings and attends other meetings, such as seminars. Maintains company organization charts and employee directory. 8. Evaluates reports, decisions and results of department in relation to established goals. Recommends new approaches, policies and procedures to effect continual improvements in efficiency of department and services performed. 9. Performs other incidental and related duties as required and assigned.

Job.Question: 518BR
Accounts Payable
Detroit
MI
Detroit
Financial
Job.JobDescription:
Looking for a pricing and financial analyst to provide cost proposal development as well as budgeting and financial analysis support to the program office.

Duties will include, but not be limited to:

Financial Analyst Duties:


  • Budget and variance analysis, expenditure and cash flow analysis, financial and contract reporting.
  • Contract set up in accounting system and maintenance of funding and budget data from award through close out. Includes making recommendations to Program Managers regarding contract WBS structure to ensure tracking and analysis at required levels for contract reporting needs and internal tracking.
  • Trend analysis of expenditures, including chart creation, calculations, and recommendations to Program Managers.
  • Review actual labor hours incurred and material and travel expenditures for compliance with contract requirements and corporate policies.
  • Support the Program Manager in development of program cost “estimates to complete” based on inception to date cost, technical and schedule performance.
  • Create new reports/spreadsheets as needed to meet Program Manager requests and/or contract reporting requirements.
  • Track subcontractor and material open commitments against budgets and expenditures.
  • Provide guidance as required to program manger on what is an allowable contract cost versus unallowable.

Pricing Duties:


  • Review solicitations for proposal requirements, identify risk areas, make bid/no-bid recommendations
  • Make recommendations for pricing strategies
  • Prepare TINA compliant cost and pricing volumes and cost narratives
  • Cost/price model development
  • Support audits and participate in cost proposal clarifications or negotiations
  • Make recommendations on WBS and pricing structure

Job.Question: 519BR
Software/System Engineer
Detroit
MI
Detroit
Technical
Job.JobDescription:
• Based on a set of requirements and desired capabilities for software recommend the most appropriate COTS, GOTS, or Open Source software products to fulfill those capabilities.
  • Determine hardware and software dependencies for COTS, GOTS, or Open Source software that will be used within a larger software architecture. Based on these dependencies, plan for appropriate software integration activities so that the COTS/GOTS/OSS in question can be integrated with as little risk and effort as possible within a classified laboratory environment.
  • Lead a team of engineers to perform installations and checkout of COTS, GOTS, or Open Source software that will be used within a larger software architecture. The installations will be performed within a classified laboratory environment in Manassas, VA.
  • Perform testing and validation on COTS, GOTS, or Open Source software that will be used within a larger software architecture, based on documented requirements for the software in question. Note that the some requirements will be functional in nature, while other requirements will stipulate adherence to design objectives such as the exposure of specific software APIs.
  • Support planning and development of automated tests, using a Government-provided test suite, for COTS, GOTS, or Open Source software to verify functionality exposed by a specific set of software APIs.
  • Document and coordinate the review of software issues and desired enhancements for COTS, GOTS, or Open Source software that is integrated and tested within a larger software architecture.
  • Review and provide input to UML software models which articulate the functionality and software interfaces to be exposed by COTS, GOTS, or Open Source software to be used within a larger software architecture.

Job.Question: 520BR
Assistant Restaurant Manager II
Detroit
MI
Detroit
Sales
Job.JobDescription:
Little Caesar Enterprises, Inc. (“LCE”), Home of the Hot-N-Ready Pizza is seeking out energetic and driven individuals with experience in a restaurant or retail environment to join the management team at one of our corporate-owned restaurants. We have Assistant Manager (part time) positions available immediately. To continue our reign as “Best Value in America” and our 10+ consecutive years of sales growth, we are looking for leaders who can motivate others, control costs, and build sales. This is a FUN and fast paced environment!

As the world’s largest carry out pizza chain in business for 50 years and 1000’s of stores worldwide, we provide numerous opportunities for growth. In fact, many of our Vice-Presidents started out as crew members and/or manager trainees! Our promote from within philosophy works, and we know it!


Required Skills

Job requirements:

  • 1-2 years experience in a high volume, quick service or fast casual restaurant environment
  • High School diploma or GED
  • Excellent leadership, communication, and team building skills
  • Positive attitude and outstanding work ethic

Job.Question: 472BR
General Labor - Loveland
Denver
CO
Denver, CO
Job.JobDescription: We use the industry’s most advanced printing equipment in our Press and Finishing Departments. Our Press department offers a high-quality, high-speed printing services. The Finishing department, where individual pages get bound into complete magazines and catalogs, offers a variety of capabilities to advance the most complex marketing ideas, including stitching, binding, polywrapping and personalization. Our Finishing technicians also perform sophisticated mail processing. Our production professionals are hard-working, flexible, and technologically savvy.

Job.Question: 269BR
Customer Sales Representative
Denver
CO
Denver, CO
Financial
Job.JobDescription:
Are you looking to start a sales career in a rewarding position that offers career advancement? This entry level sales role may be what you’re looking for! As a Customer Sales Representative, you will use your customer service and sales abilities to answer inbound calls in the Afni contact call center. In this inside sales role, you will have 6 – 8 weeks of paid training designed to help you succeed. Afni offers a great hourly wage with bonus opportunities, career advancement, full-line of medical benefits and tuition reimbursement! Think you have what it takes to perform the following duties?


  • Build and maintain rapport with customers
  • Identify customer needs; review and update activity on accounts
  • Resolve customer issues in a prompt, professional and friendly manner
  • Promote and sell products and services to meet goals
  • Attend training to update product knowledge
